In *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*, the **ampersand** (**&**) serves the following purposes:

- & represents major demons:

  - & [water demon](/wiki/Water_demon "Water demon")
  - & [horned devil](/wiki/Horned_devil "Horned devil")
  - & [succubus](/wiki/Succubus "Succubus")
  - & [incubus](/wiki/Incubus "Incubus")
  - & [erinys](/wiki/Erinys "Erinys")
  - & [barbed devil](/wiki/Barbed_devil "Barbed devil")
  - & [marilith](/wiki/Marilith "Marilith")
  - & [vrock](/wiki/Vrock "Vrock")
  - & [hezrou](/wiki/Hezrou "Hezrou")
  - & [bone devil](/wiki/Bone_devil "Bone devil")
  - & [ice devil](/wiki/Ice_devil "Ice devil")
  - & [nalfeshnee](/wiki/Nalfeshnee "Nalfeshnee")
  - & [pit fiend](/wiki/Pit_fiend "Pit fiend")
  - & [balrog](/wiki/Balrog "Balrog")
  - & [Juiblex](/wiki/Juiblex "Juiblex")
  - & [Yeenoghu](/wiki/Yeenoghu "Yeenoghu")
  - & [Orcus](/wiki/Orcus "Orcus")
  - & [Geryon](/wiki/Geryon "Geryon")
  - & [Dispater](/wiki/Dispater "Dispater")
  - & [Baalzebub](/wiki/Baalzebub "Baalzebub")
  - & [Asmodeus](/wiki/Asmodeus "Asmodeus")
  - & [Demogorgon](/wiki/Demogorgon "Demogorgon")

- & represents the endgame [riders](/wiki/Four_Horsemen_of_the_Apocalypse "Four Horsemen of the Apocalypse"):

  - & [Death](/wiki/Death_\(monster\) "Death (monster)")
  - & [Pestilence](/wiki/Pestilence "Pestilence")
  - & [Famine](/wiki/Famine "Famine")

- & [mail daemon](/wiki/Mail_daemon "Mail daemon")

- & [djinn](/wiki/Djinn "Djinn")

- & [sandestins](/wiki/Sandestin "Sandestin")

* [&]() is a command used to tell you what another command does. For example, type [&]() + [h](/wiki/H "H") to see the message "*h Go west 1 space (if number\_pad is on, display help message)*".

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

[SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") introduces new creatures that use the & glyph:

- & major demon:

  - & [spined devil](/wiki/Spined_devil "Spined devil")
  - & [bearded devil](/wiki/Bearded_devil "Bearded devil")
  - & [bar-lgura](/wiki/Bar-lgura "Bar-lgura")
  - & [chasme](/wiki/Chasme "Chasme")
  - & [babau](/wiki/Babau "Babau")
  - & [nabassu](/wiki/Nabassu "Nabassu")
  - & [Maugneshaagar](/wiki/Maugneshaagar "Maugneshaagar")

### UnNetHack

[UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack") introduces [lava demons](/wiki/Lava_demon "Lava demon"), which are represented by &.
html:
&

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
Printable ASCII characters
~ ! @ # $ % ^ & * ( ) _ + space
` 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8 9 0 - = { } |
Qq Ww Ee Rr Tt Yy Uu Ii Oo Pp : " [ ] \
Aa Ss Dd Ff Gg Hh Jj Kk Ll ? ; ' Ctrl
Zz Xx Cc Vv Bb Nn Mm , . / < > Alt

In NetHack, the ampersand (&) serves the following purposes:

  • & represents major demons:
    • & water demon
    • & horned devil
    • & succubus
    • & incubus
    • & erinys
    • & barbed devil
    • & marilith
    • & vrock
    • & hezrou
    • & bone devil
    • & ice devil
    • & nalfeshnee
    • & pit fiend
    • & balrog
    • & Juiblex
    • & Yeenoghu
    • & Orcus
    • & Geryon
    • & Dispater
    • & Baalzebub
    • & Asmodeus
    • & Demogorgon
  • & represents the endgame riders:
    • & Death
    • & Pestilence
    • & Famine
  • & mail daemon
  • & djinn
  • & sandestins
  • & is a command used to tell you what another command does. For example, type & + h to see the message "h Go west 1 space (if number_pad is on, display help message)".

Variants

SLASH'EM

SLASH'EM introduces new creatures that use the & glyph:

  • & major demon:
    • & spined devil
    • & bearded devil
    • & bar-lgura
    • & chasme
    • & babau
    • & nabassu
    • & Maugneshaagar

UnNetHack

UnNetHack introduces lava demons, which are represented by &.
